ygData.subject: Re: Inspecting
ygData.msgSnippet: Heh, well, im the opposite of that, i get ticked if someone bugs me by asking if they can inspect. (esp in a party)  But, ah well. I m out of my mind, but feel
ygData.messageBody:
Heh, well, im the opposite of that, i get ticked if someone bugs me by
asking if they can inspect. (esp in a party) But, ah well.


I'm out of my mind, but feel free to leave a message...



----- Original Message -----
From: Lanadina the Magician <lanadina@...>
To: <EverQuest@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, February 09, 2000 7:20 AM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Inspecting


> From: "Lanadina the Magician" <lanadina@...>
>
> Wizaro,
>
> Like I said...its a personal issue for me. I think its just common
courtesy
> for someone to ASK before inspecting. Its called being polite. I never
> inspect without asking, so I expect the same respect in return.
>
> Lana
>
>
> ----Original Message Follows----
> From: MFerrulo@...
> Reply-To: EverQuest@onelist.com
> To: EverQuest@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Inspecting
> Date: Tue, 8 Feb 2000 19:01:23 EST
>
> In a message dated 02/07/2000 1:58:41 PM Eastern Standard Time,
> lanadina@... writes:
>
> <<
> hehee I thought I was the only one bothered by it. Yes...I find it rude
if
> people inspect and don't ask first. That is like some stranger coming to
> my
> door and walking in and checking out my CD Collection hehe
> >>
>
> How? I'm totally confused? Some starnger sees you on the street - he can
> see
> your Boots, your Cloak, your jewelry, your hat. Do you run away from
> everyone who looks at you in the real world? Someone walking into my
house
> and checking out my CD collection would be rude as hell I agree, but in EQ
> we
> have no homes, so we keep all our possessions in the bank and in item
slots
> and containers. NO ONE CAN SEE THESE!!! As it should be. I am dumfounded
> that people in EQ are upset that people can see what they have ON THIER
> BODIES.
>
> Wizaro Wrathcaster
>
